qas.question: Where did Athanasius remain for 6 years while living as a monk?
What is name of one of the compositions composed by Athanasius while he lived as a monk?
Who influenced George of Cappadocia to become the new ruler?
Who was appointed to rule the see of Alexandria?
To where did Saint Athanasius withdraw?
How long did he spend in the desert?
What is one thing he wrote during this time?
Who influenced the appointment of George of Cappadocia?

context: Through the influence of <a3_0><a8_0>the Eusebian faction at Constantinople<a8_0/><a3_0/>, an Arian bishop, <a2_0><a4_0>George of Cappadocia<a4_0/><a2_0/>, was now appointed to rule the see of <b9_0>Alexandria<b9_0/>. <b10_0>Athanasius<b10_0/>, after remaining some days in the neighbourhood of the city, finally withdrew into <a5_0>the desert of <a0_0>Upper Egypt<a5_0/><a0_0/>, where he remained for a period of <a6_0>six years<a6_0/>, living the life of the <b11_0>monks<b11_0/>, devoting himself to the composition of a group of writings; "<a7_0>Apology to Constantius<a7_0/>", the "Apology for his Flight", the "<a1_0>Letter to the Monks<a1_0/>", and the "History of the Arians".
